snippet.textDisplay: I remember as a kid being impressed by Mario's sleeping animation during the ending. I know that Nintendo went with the twist that Mario was dreaming all along to separate this game's world based on Doki Doki Panic from the Mario canon world, but I feel like they should just embrace it now. Did you realize Shy Guys have never made any other appearance in the mainline series where you directly control Mario? It seems crazy. I wonder if Nintendo will ever bring the SMB2 style to Mario Maker because of that.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember as a kid being impressed by Mario's sleeping animation during the ending. I know that Nintendo went with the twist that Mario was dreaming all along to separate this game's world based on Doki Doki Panic from the Mario canon world, but I feel like they should just embrace it now. Did you realize Shy Guys have never made any other appearance in the mainline series where you directly control Mario? It seems crazy. I wonder if Nintendo will ever bring the SMB2 style to Mario Maker because of that.

snippet.textDisplay: I might be wrong about this, but weren't all the enemies in Super Mario Bros 2 designed the exact same and had the same names in Doki Doki Panic? Meaning that Shy Guys aren't technically "Mario" characters, since as we all know Doki Doki came out first. Obviously nowadays Birdo and Shy Guys and the rest are recognized as Mario characters, but they originally weren't. Like I said idk maybe I'm completely wrong.
snippet.textOriginal: I might be wrong about this, but weren't all the enemies in Super Mario Bros 2 designed the exact same and had the same names in Doki Doki Panic? Obviously nowadays Birdo and Shy Guys and the rest are recognized as Mario characters, but they originally weren't. Like I said idk maybe I'm completely wrong.

snippet.textDisplay: So shy guys are technically non-canonical?  That is pretty crazy!

snippet.textDisplay: @Bartosz Skorupa 1) Mario RPG is not a mainline Mario game in the same way that Paper Mario and Mario and Luigi are not mainline games. 2) The shy guys in Mario 64 are not actually shy guys but snifits, a completely different enemy. 3) Please be more considerate when trying to debunk someone's harmless fun facts. Thanks!
snippet.textOriginal: @Bartosz Skorupa 1) Mario RPG is not a mainline Mario game in the same way that Paper Mario and Mario and Luigi are not mainline games. 2) The shy guys in Mario 64 are not actually shy guys but snifits, a completely different enemy. 3) Please be more considerate when trying to debunk someone's harmless fun facts. Thanks!

snippet.textDisplay: Mario RPGs are not part of the mainline series. True there were Fly Guys in Mario 64, but I really had in mind just the normal Shy Guys. In the end though, even including Fly Guys, the point is that they are so popular that it's surprising to see how little representation they actually do get (in the mainline series).
snippet.textOriginal: Mario RPGs are not part of the mainline series. True there were Fly Guys in Mario 64, but I really had in mind just the normal Shy Guys.
